climbs.name: This Morning I am Born Again

content.description: Breakfast in Hells little brother.  Start off of sharp pocket, up to sinker 1 1/2 finger pocket, good pockets under roof up to good holds above roof.  Don't use the large chossy block to the left it will probably fall off some day!
content.location: Just left of Breakfast in Hell, look for obvious slot in the roof.  Line climbs directly below this crack.  Might be worth inspecting the topout, could be dirty...  pretty well cleaned as of today but...

content.description: Start on shoulder height holds in somewhat suspect rock.  Pull up to the flat ledge and work the feet up until you can get two hand jams in the horizontal on the back of the ledge.  Power up and top out
content.location: Left of Call it Sleep and about 10 ft right of Breakfast in Hell.

content.description: Where a large manky chunk of rock once was lies the start of this highball.  Start on the low rail and move your way up through the pinches and to a good match.  Figure out how to really stretch to some marginal, hard to find holds.  Things get a little dicey moving up to the twin finger cracks that lead to the good ledge.
content.protection: PADS.  We tried to shore up the landing zone, but it would still be pretty sketchy to blow off the top.
content.location: To the right of Broke Down, look for the landing area and start at the obvious rock scar on the wall.

content.description: Roof with a funky crack, similar to Breakfast in Hell, but not as tall or as commiting!  Good hand jams at the lip to jugs on climbers left.  Watch out for the cacti.  Some pruning of the Juniper, but couldn't bring myself to hurt those claret cups!
content.location: About 50ft rt. of Breakfast in Hell, behind a large limestone boulder and nestled in some junipers

content.description: The stemming problem between Broke Down and Race Car Joe.  I remember seeing Wade messing around on this but not sure if he sent it.  If not its a feather in Cara's hippy cap.   Stem, stem, stem until you top out.  Watch out for hollow sounding flake on the rt. side up high, it will be obvious.  Easiest problem on in this area so far, but topping out around 18-20 ft its not inconsequential.

Not exactly on the Booze Pig wall, head south along cliff line, past Long Ryder for about 5-10 minutes looking for a tall roof/wall above the old road, about 30 yds up a steep slope.  Balancey climbing through brittle rock up to finger lock and to a short roof crack.  Very commiting move out through the roof to a mantle onto a ledge with a walk off.  Suss out the topout, watch out for cactus and pine needles on the top out. Problem feels taller due to slope of the hillside cutting out underneath you.  Still awaiting second ascent.
content.protection: Brave spotter or small spotter for extra incentive to send

content.description: Good moderate up good hold, just high enough to make you appreciate it
content.location: To the right of Breakfast in Hell, climb the pink streak trending right at the top

pathTokens: Land of High Bouldering AKA The Ridge

content.description: Small area with a handful of highball problems!  Just to clarify I'm not certain beyond a doubt that these are FA's, but based on the amount of cleaning and choss that covers this wall I'm pretty sure they are.  However I will gladly make any needed changes to descriptions based on past visitors.  That being said these lines are mostly choss free, might need to clean the top holds but most loose stuff is off.
